title: Issues with installation of scanners
body:
Scanners show wrong quality after installation:
Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Run ZAP (2.4.2), without add-ons with scanners (so that's easier to reproduce the issue);
2. Install add-ons with active and passive scanners (for example, add-ons "Active scanner rules" and "Passive scanner rules");
3. Open the "Scan Policy Manager" dialogue (Ctrl+P), select "Default policy", press "Modify" button and note that the installed scanners shown "Unknown" quality;
4. Open the "Options" dialogue, select "Passive Scan Rules" and note the same issue.

Active scanners added twice on add-on installation:
Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Run ZAP (2.4.2), without add-ons with active scanners;
2. Install the add-on with active scanners (for example, "Active scanner rules" add-on);
3. Note the messages in the log, which means that the scanners are being loaded twice:

```
38801 [AWT-EventQueue-0] INFO org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory  - loaded plugin Path Traversal
38801 [AWT-EventQueue-0] INFO org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory  - Ignoring (apparently) less stable scanner version, id=6, ExistingPlugin[Status=release, Class=org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascanrules.TestPathTraversal], LessStablePlugin[Status=unknown, Class=org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascanrules.TestPathTraversal]
```

with 2.4.0, the messages are different:

```
79916 [AWT-EventQueue-0] INFO org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory  - loaded plugin Path Traversal
79916 [AWT-EventQueue-0] ERROR org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory  - Duplicate id 6 org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascanrules.TestPathTraversal org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascanrules.TestPathTraversal
```

4. Uninstall the add-on with active scanners (for example, "Active scanner rules" add-on);
5. Open the "Scan Policy Manager" dialogue (Ctrl+P), modify the "Default policy" and note, by the errors logged, that the scanners of the uninstalled add-on are still loaded (since just the first scanner was removed):

```
151700 [AWT-EventQueue-0] ERROR org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory  - Can't find resource for bundle java.util.PropertyResourceBundle, key ascanrules.testpathtraversal.name
java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find resource for bundle java.util.PropertyResourceBundle, key ascanrules.testpathtraversal.name
    at java.util.ResourceBundle.getObject(ResourceBundle.java:450)
    at java.util.ResourceBundle.getString(ResourceBundle.java:407)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.utils.I18N.getString(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascanrules.TestPathTraversal.getName(TestPathTraversal.java:185)
    at org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner.PluginFactory.loadAllPlugin(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascan.ScanPolicy.<init>(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascan.PolicyManager.loadPolicy(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascan.PolicyManager.getPolicy(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascan.ExtensionActiveScan.showPolicyDialog(Unknown Source)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.ascan.PolicyManagerDialog$2.actionPerformed(Unknown Source)
```

Remarks:
Although the issues are different they are related (fixing the first should fix the second).

ZAP Version:
Versions >= 2.4.0
